clumpy.LandUseLayer¶

class clumpy.LandUseLayer(palette, label=None, time=0, path=None, data=None, copy_geo=None)[source]¶

Bases: clumpy._base._layer.Layer

Define a Land Use Cover (LUC) layer. This layer can then used for the calibration stage or the allocation stage.

Parameters

  • palette (Palette) – The states palette.

  • label (str, default=``None``) – The layer label.

  • time (float, default=``0``) – The layer time (year unit).

  • path (str) – The tiff file path. If data is provided, a new tiff file will be created according to this path and this operation overwrites the file path if exists.

  • data (numpy.ndarray, defaul=None) – The data to write. If None, no writing is made.

  • copy_geo (LandUseLayer, default=None) – The layer from whose geo metadata are copied. If None, geo metadata are set to None.

Attributes

  • raster_ (rasterio.io.DatasetReader) – The unbuffered data and metadata reader object, provided by rasterio.

  • style_ (list of dict) – The style used for displaying.

Methods

display(center, window[, show, colorbar])

Display the land use cover layer through python console with matplotlib.

export(path)

Export the layer according to the file extension.

export_asc(path[, round])

Export the layer data as an asc file in order to use it through CLUES and CLUMondo.

set_palette(palette)

Set palette

get_data
display(center, window, show=True, colorbar=True)[source]¶

Display the land use cover layer through python console with matplotlib.

Parameters

  • center (tuple of two integers) – Center position as a tuple.

  • window (tuple of two integers) – Window dimensions as a tuple.

  • show (bool, default=True) – If True, the plt.show() is applied.

  • colorbar (bool, default=True) – If True, the colorbar is displayed.

Returns

plt – Pyplot object

Return type

matplotlib.pyplot

export(path)¶

Export the layer according to the file extension. See GDAL for available extenstions. For floating rst, the data should be np.float32. :param path: path to the file. :type path: str

export_asc(path, round=4)¶

Export the layer data as an asc file in order to use it through CLUES and CLUMondo.

Parameters

  • path (str) – path to the file.

  • round (int, default=4) – Number of decimals to keep if data is not an dtype integer array.

Set palette

Parameters

palette (Palette) – The palette.

Returns

self – The self object.

Return type

LandUseLayer
